data.title: Rockford Area Economic Development Council - Rockford, Illinois, USA - Rockford Area Economic Development Council
data.meta_description: Rockford Area Economic Development Council is dedicated to advancing business development in the area. Learn more about the available incentives & benefits.
data.meta_site_name: Rockford, Illinois, USA - Rockford Area Economic Development Council
data.text:
The Rockford Region is an ideal place for businesses looking to expand and thrive, particularly those in the aerospace, healthcare, and advanced manufacturing industries.

Companies have the opportunity to enjoy property tax abatements, investment tax credits, state tax exemptions, dividends deductions, and more.

Workforce

The Rockford Region has established nimble, industry-specific, and customized education-to-workforce pipelines ensuring the region has the skilled workforce essential to fulfilling the requirements of jobs that are good today, tomorrow, and in the future.

Aerospace

The Rockford Region is home to four tier-one companies and more than 250 suppliers within a 90-minute radius. Our current collection of companies serves aerospace industry leaders such as AAR, Boeing, and Airbus. These businesses are world-renowned corporations focused on designing, manufacturing, maintenance, overhaul, and selling aerospace products.

Advanced Manufacturing Industry

The Rockford Region is also ideal for manufacturing companies. Businesses located here understand the importance of quality and consistency. The region’s long history of making things transfers these qualities from automotive, to aerospace, and to medical device manufacturing. From large scale, long run parts to customized small runs our region has a company that can do it.

We even offer a great pool of suitable manufacturing sites. In fact, the construction engineering company Carter and Burgess conducted a study that found that the Rockford area is an optimal location for site selection.

Logistics

We are within miles of four interstates and four major railroads, along with several airports, including the Chicago Rockford International Airport and Chicago O’Hare International Airport. With proximity to these major distribution resources, companies can transport their products with speed and efficiency.
